title: Zimbabwe: Masvingo Hospital Unleashes Debt Collectors On Patients to Recover U.S.$3 Million
text:
Zimbabwe: Mugabe Recalls Parliament Over Job Losses - Report 
"We have started the legal process which will see you lose valuable property and other accessories. 
"You are hereby warned that if you do not make frantic efforts to settle the debt within 8 hours after receiving this letter you will be liable for costs and other expenses," reads part of the notice. 
Patients who received the notice were shocked at the amount the institution now requires, claiming they bought drugs from local pharmacies while receiving treatment at the institution. 
"I was admitted at the institution for a week and bought all my medication from pharmacies. 
"Nurses had told me they are out of stock, but now I am seeing a $420 bill which should be paid within eight hours. 
"How will I raise the money under this economic environment," said one Rumbidzai Ndove. 
Provincial Medical Director Amadiof Shamu confirmed the development but referred further questions to the hospital's medical administrator Dr Julias Chirengwa who declined to comment. 
Sources at the hospital said the institution is in dire need of finances to buy essential drugs and replace obsolete equipment. 
Despite the shortages of medicines and equipment, the institution is also said to owe a number of service providers who include Masvingo City Council. 
"The hospital needs the money to improve the quality of services. Although government is mandated to fund its operations, the money has not been forthcoming. 
"People think that public hospital services are offered for free but that is not the case; user fees are essential for the hospital to continue offering health services to people," said a source Zimbabwe
